intro: Dinteracanthus velutinus, commonly known as the velvet spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with latex-producing characteristics. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, velvety leaves and yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
